content.question: The third derivative of the function f is continuous on the interval (0,4). Values for f and its first three derivatives at x=2 are given in the table above. What is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <munder> <mrow> <mi>lim</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn> </mrow> </munder> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@463F@</annotation> </semantics> </math>?
